intro: Teclea eggelingii, commonly known as the Ethiopian nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, followed by yellow berries that contain the seeds. Teclea eggelingii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in the study of Ethiopian flora.
